Organs/Tissues: Any cell type (2D or 3D); widely used for tumor spheroids or general cell lines
Physiological/Pathological: Both – can monitor normal intracellular pH or pathology-induced pH shifts (e.g. tumor acidity)
Cell Source: Compatible with primary cells, immortalized lines, iPSCs, organoids, etc.
Multiple Cell Types: Yes (chips can be internalized by multiple cell types in co-culture)
Tissue-resident Immune: Yes (immune cells can internalize chips, e.g. macrophages, microglia)
Circulating Immune: Yes (can measure T-cell or PBMC pH in suspension)
Crosstalk (Multi-tissue): N/A – sensor works in any multi-tissue or single-tissue system
Air-Liquid Interface: Yes, sensor usage not hindered by ALI
Extracellular Matrix: Yes, works in 3D spheroids/organoids with ECM
3D Scaffold: Yes, can be used in hydrogel or scaffold-based tissues
Notable Features: Intracellular pH measurement in real time, also can measure extracellular pH if partially embedded (SpheroCHECK version). Non-toxic, stable over days.
Plate/Format (Throughput): Works in any standard plates (6, 24, 96, 384) for fluorescence imaging (high-throughput possible)
Max Culture Duration: Days to weeks (chips remain in cells, stable fluorescence)
Readouts - Cell Retrieval: Yes, post-experiment (chips won't block qPCR, etc.)
Readouts - Whole Tissue: Yes (can fix tissues containing chips, do histology)
Readouts - Integrated Biosensors: Yes (the SPAchip itself is an integrated pH biosensor)
Dead Volume: N/A (standard culture volumes; no special device dead space)
Perfused: Yes if user’s system is perfused; the chips do not interfere
Gas Mix Controlled: Standard incubator or external device for O2/CO2 control
Real-time Microenvironment Control: Yes, user can change conditions (drug, pH) in real time and monitor intracellular response
model_availability: Both (SPAchip kits are products; A4Cell also offers cell assay services)

Organs/Tissues: Any cell model with calcium signaling (neurons, cardiomyocytes, etc.)
Physiological/Pathological: Both – normal Ca²⁺ signaling vs. pathological dysregulation (neurodegeneration, cardiotoxicity)
Cell Source: Any cell line or primary/hiPSC-derived cell with Ca²⁺ flux of interest
Crosstalk (Multi-tissue): N/A – sensor can be applied in multi-tissue setups
Notable Features: Real-time intracellular Ca²⁺ imaging, stable over time, no dye leakage
Plate/Format (Throughput): Any standard plate for fluorescence; high-content imaging possible
Readouts - MEA: No direct MEA integration; can be combined externally
Perfused: Compatible with perfusion from external system
Gas Mix Controlled: Not by SPAchip, user supplies environment
Real-time Microenvironment Control: Yes, can do dynamic stimulation (e.g. agonists) while imaging

Organs/Tissues: All cell types, commonly fibroblasts, cancer cells, etc. for oxidative stress studies
Physiological/Pathological: Both – baseline ROS vs. oxidative stress in pathology
Notable Features: Monitors ROS (e.g. hydroxyl radicals) in living cells, stable long-term measurement
Plate/Format (Throughput): Compatible with standard multi-well plates; high-content imaging
Perfused: Yes if user’s setup includes flow
Real-time Microenvironment Control: Yes, stimuli can be applied while measuring ROS changes

Organs/Tissues: Any cells requiring multiplex intracellular monitoring
Physiological/Pathological: Both – track 2 parameters in parallel for normal/disease states
Notable Features: Simultaneous readout of 2 signals in single cell, stable fluorescence imaging
Plate/Format (Throughput): Any standard plate, can scale to 96/384 wells
Readouts - Integrated Biosensors: Yes (dual parameter sensors on a single chip)
Real-time Microenvironment Control: Yes (user can add treatments in real time)
